intro: Siler montanum subsp. garganicum, commonly known as the mountain siler, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks, and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
